arguments.content:
IFRS 17 Amendments – March 2024

Effective 1 April 2024.

Art. 5‑1

The discount rate shall be determined using observable market inputs, with a fallback to an internally developed model where markets are not observable.

Art. 12‑3

Entities must disclose the methodology used to calculate the contract‑level risk adjustment, including assumptions about future cash‑flow volatility.

Implementation Guidance Update – February 2024

Effective 1 July 2024.

Art. 20‑2

Reinsurance contracts shall be accounted for using the same measurement model as the underlying insurance contracts, unless a specific exemption applies.

Art. 27‑1

Public sector entities (OPEB) may apply the simplified reporting approach, reducing the granularity of contract groupings.

- **Discount‑rate methodology**: New fallback to internal models when market data is unavailable – aligns with existing Discount‑Rate Policy (CC‑01).
- **Risk‑adjustment disclosure**: Additional requirement to disclose assumptions on cash‑flow volatility – covered by Risk‑Adjustment Disclosure control (CC‑02).

arguments.title: IFRS 17 Update – Impact Summary
arguments.body:
## IFRS 17 – Recent Amendments (Effective Apr‑Jun 2024)

- **Discount‑rate methodology**: New fallback to internal models when market data is unavailable – aligns with existing Discount‑Rate Policy (CC‑01).
- **Risk‑adjustment disclosure**: Additional requirement to disclose assumptions on cash‑flow volatility – covered by Risk‑Adjustment Disclosure control (CC‑02).
- **Reinsurance accounting**: Must now use the same measurement model as primary contracts – matches Reinsurance Accounting control (CC‑03).
- **OPEB reporting**: Allows a simplified approach for public‑sector entities – reflected in OPEB Simplified Reporting control (CC‑04).

Please review the changes and update any related SOPs where necessary.
